text:
There are several places in the code that are passing a "" URI into
WebdavUtils.getAbsolutePath or one of its callers. If slide is configured with a
non-empty scope, both getAbsolutePath methods will mis-index the supplied URI.
I've fixed (and had patched) one of these callers already, but I have found at
least 2 more. Attached is a more general fix.
creator: JRRousseau@gmail.com
JRRousseau@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 13985
Patch to fix scope indexing problem

creator: masonjm@apache.org
text: The patch was a little out of date, so I applied it manually. Should be fixed now.

I just got a chance to take a look at this. Sorry for the delay. 

I just updated and pulled rev 1.33 of WebdavUtils.java down. There are two
getAbsolutePath() methods in WebdavUtils. Only one was patched (my original
patch addressed both).

Attached is a new patch against 1.33.
creator: JRRousseau@gmail.com

text:
Created attachment 14153
Patch to prevent string mis-index in WebdavUtils.java
creator: JRRousseau@gmail.com

text:
Bah. I thought I'd gotten them both.

Thanks John.
creator: masonjm@apache.org
